events.event_name: North Macedonia December 2025 Trade Data Release
events.description: The release of trade balance figures for North Macedonia for December 2025 and the full year summary.

facts.fact_text: North Macedonia's trade deficit narrowed to $295 million in December 2025 from $388 million in December 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: North Macedonia’s trade deficit narrowed to $295 million in December 2025 from $388 million in the same month of the previous year.

facts.fact_text: Exports increased by 21% year-on-year to $717 million in December.
Imports rose by 20% year-on-year to $1,181 million in December.

evidences.evidence_text: imports rose at a slightly slower pace of 20% to $1,181 million.

facts.fact_text: The total trade deficit for the full year reached $3,504 million.

evidences.evidence_text: For the whole year, the country’s trade deficit reached $3,504 million.

claims.claim_text: The growth in exports was primarily driven by the beverages, tobacco, machinery, and transport equipment sectors.

evidences.evidence_text: attributed to an increase in sales of beverages and tobacco (38.2%), machinery and transport equipment (16.1%), miscellaneous manufactured articles (3.6%), and crude materials (9.1%).

claims.claim_text: The rise in imports was largely influenced by increased purchases of food, oils, and chemical products.

evidences.evidence_text: driven largely by higher purchases of food and live animals (10.8%), animal and vegetable oil and fats and waxes (23.6%), chemical and related products (9.3%), and miscellaneous manufactured articles (9%).

evidence.evidence_text: North Macedonia’s trade deficit narrowed to $295 million in December 2025
driven largely by higher purchases of food and live animals (10.8%), animal and vegetable oil and fats and waxes (23.6%)
